PATTERN_QUOTE

public static final Mapper<CharSequence,String> PATTERN_QUOTE
Maps character sequences to their corresponding literal pattern strings.

Method Detail

toLowerCase

public static String toLowerCase(CharSequence charSeq)

Changes the given text to lower case. That is, any upper case character in the text (e.g. a letter) will be replaced with its lower case counterpart.

This method is primarily here for orthogonality, as the String class (likely the most commonly-used CharSequence) already has a toLowerCase() method.

Parameters:
charSeq - the text to change
Returns:
a lower case copy of the text
See Also:
String.toLowerCase(), toTitleCase(CharSequence), toUpperCase(CharSequence)

toUpperCase

public static String toUpperCase(CharSequence charSeq)

Changes the given text to upper case. That is, any lower case character in the text (e.g. a letter) will be replaced with its upper case counterpart.

This method is primarily here for orthogonality, as the String class (likely the most commonly-used CharSequence) already has a toUpperCase() method.

Parameters:
charSeq - the text to change
Returns:
an upper case copy of the text
See Also:
String.toUpperCase(), toLowerCase(CharSequence), toTitleCase(CharSequence)

toTitleCase

public static String toTitleCase(CharSequence charSeq)

Changes the given text to title case. That is, the text will be changed to lower case, except for the first character of each word, which will be changed to upper case.

Here, a word is not necessarily alphanumeric, but may be any sequence of non-whitespace characters.

Parameters:
charSeq - the text to change
Returns:
a title case copy of the text
See Also:
toTitleCase(CharSequence, int), toLowerCase(CharSequence), toUpperCase(CharSequence)

toTitleCase

public static String toTitleCase(CharSequence charSeq,
                                 int limit)
Changes the given text to title case, capitalizing words up to the specified limit. That is, this method behaves just like the single-argument version, except that any words beyond the limit will not be capitalized. They will still be changed to lower case, however.

Parameters:
charSeq - the text to change
limit - the maximum number of words to capitalize
Returns:
a title case copy of the text
See Also:
toTitleCase(CharSequence)

Reverses the order of the characters in the given text.

Returns:

                          Iterator<? extends CharSequence> charSeqs)
Joins a group of character sequences into a single string, using the given separator.

Parameters:
separator - the separator between adjacent joined sequences
charSeqs - the sequences to join
Returns:
a single string containing all the sequences, joined by the separator

toUrl

public static URL toUrl(CharSequence charSeq)

Convenience method for building URL objects from character sequences that doesn't throw a MalformedURLException.

If the URL is guaranteed to be valid, calling this method is terser than wrapping in a try-catch block. Avoid this method if you don't have that guarantee.

Parameters:
charSeq - the character sequence representation of the URL
Returns:
an object representation of the URL
